meanings.definition: To convert or adapt to an attic.
meanings.sent1: The old house was atticized to create more living space.
meanings.sent2: They atticized the storage room into a cozy attic bedroom.
meanings.sent3: The atticized attic now serves as a peaceful retreat.
meanings.sent4: Her mind atticized the cluttered thoughts into organized compartments.
meanings.sent5: The atticized attic felt like a hidden treasure trove.

meanings.sent1: The architect atticized the new building with a spacious attic.
meanings.sent2: They atticized the house with a ladder leading up to the attic.
meanings.sent3: The atticized attic was filled with forgotten treasures.
meanings.sent4: Her words atticized the room with warmth and comfort.
meanings.sent5: The atticized attic was a cozy addition to the home.

meanings.sent1: They atticized the top floor to create a new attic space.
meanings.sent2: The renovation atticized the old storage area into a functional attic.
meanings.sent3: The atticized attic became the favorite spot for stargazing.
meanings.sent4: Her creativity atticized the plain room into a magical attic.
meanings.sent5: The atticized attic provided a quiet escape from the world.
